verses.verse: After<WH310> these things<WH1697>, when the wrath<WH2534> of king<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325> was appeased<WH7918>, he remembered<WH2142> Vashti<WH2060>, and what she had done<WH6213>, and what was decreed against her<WH1504>.
Then said<WH559> the king<WH4428>'s servants<WH5288> that ministered<WH8334> unto him<WH2896>, Let there be fair young<WH5291> virgins<WH1330> sought<WH1245> for the king<WH4428>:

And let the maiden<WH5291> which pleases<WH3190> the king<WH4428> be queen<WH4427> instead of Vashti<WH2060>. And the thing<WH1697> pleased<WH3190> the king<WH4428>; and he did so<WH6213>.

Now in Shushan<WH7800> the palace<WH1002> there was a certain<WH376> Jew<WH3064>, whose name<WH8034> was Mordecai<WH4782>, the son<WH1121> of Jair<WH2971>, the son<WH1121> of Shimei<WH8096>, the son<WH1121> of Kish<WH7027>, a Benjamite<WH1145>;

And he brought up<WH539> Hadassah<WH1919>, that is<WH635>, Esther, his uncle<WH1730>'s daughter<WH1323>: for she had neither father<WH1> nor mother<WH517>, and the maid<WH5291> was fair<WH3303> and beautiful<WH2896>; whom Mordecai<WH4782>, when her father<WH1> and mother<WH517> were dead<WH4194>, took<WH3947> for his own daughter<WH1323>.

So it came to pass<WH4428>, when the king's commandment<WH1697> and his decree<WH1881> was heard<WH8085>, and when many<WH7227> maidens<WH5291> were gathered together<WH6908> unto Shushan<WH7800> the palace<WH1002>, to the custody<WH3027> of Hegai<WH1896>, that Esther<WH635> was brought<WH3947> also unto the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>, to the custody<WH3027> of Hegai<WH1896>, keeper<WH8104> of the women<WH802>.

And the maiden<WH5291> pleased<WH3190> him<WH5375>, and she obtained kindness<WH2617> of him<WH6440>; and he speedily<WH926> gave<WH5414> her her things for purification<WH8562>, with such things as belonged<WH4490> to her<WH7651>, and seven maidens<WH5291>, which were meet<WH7200> to be given<WH5414> her<WH4428>, out of the king's house<WH1004>: and he preferred<WH8138> her and her maids<WH5291> unto the best<WH2896> place of the house<WH1004> of the women<WH802>.
Esther<WH635> had not showed<WH5046> her people<WH5971> nor her relatives<WH4138>: for Mordecai<WH4782> had commanded<WH6680> her that she should not show it<WH5046>.

And Mordecai<WH4782> walked<WH1980> every day<WH3117> before<WH6440> the court<WH2691> of the women<WH802>'s house<WH1004>, to know<WH3045> how Esther<WH635> did<WH7965>, and what should become of her<WH6213>.

Now when every maid<WH5291>'s turn<WH8447> was come<WH5060> to go in<WH935> to king<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325>, after<WH7093> that she had been twelve<WH8147> months<WH2320>, according to the manner<WH1881> of the women<WH802>, (for so were the days<WH3117> of their purifications<WH4795> accomplished<WH4390>, to know<WH8337>, six months<WH2320> with oil<WH8081> of myrrh<WH4753>, and six<WH8337> months<WH2320> with sweet odors<WH1314>, and with other things for the purifying<WH8562> of the women<WH802>;)

Then thus came<WH935> every maiden<WH5291> unto the king<WH4428>; whatever she desired<WH559> was given<WH5414> her to go<WH935> with her out of the house<WH1004> of the women<WH802> unto the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>.

In the evening<WH6153> she went<WH935>, and on the morrow<WH1242> she returned<WH7725> into the second<WH8145> house<WH1004> of the women<WH802>, to the custody<WH3027> of Shaashgaz<WH8190>, the king<WH4428>'s chamberlain<WH5631>, which kept<WH8104> the concubines<WH6370>: she came in<WH935> unto the king<WH4428> no more<WH4428>, except the king delighted<WH2654> in her<WH7121>, and that she were called by name<WH8034>.

Now when the turn<WH8447> of Esther<WH635>, the daughter<WH1323> of Abihail<WH32> the uncle<WH1730> of Mordecai<WH4782>, who had taken<WH3947> her for his daughter<WH1323>, was come<WH5060> to go in<WH935> unto the king<WH4428>, she required<WH1245> nothing<WH1697> but what Hegai<WH1896> the king<WH4428>'s chamberlain<WH5631>, the keeper<WH8104> of the women<WH802>, appointed<WH559>. And Esther<WH635> obtained<WH5375> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of all them that looked upon her<WH7200>.

So Esther<WH635> was taken<WH3947> unto king<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325> into his house<WH1004> royal<WH4438> in the tenth<WH6224> month<WH2320>, which is the month<WH2320> Tebeth<WH2887>, in the seventh<WH7651> year<WH8141> of his reign<WH4438>.

And the king<WH4428> loved<WH157> Esther<WH635> above all the women<WH802>, and she obtained<WH5375> grace<WH2580> and favor<WH2617> in his sight<WH6440> more than all the virgins<WH1330>; so that he set<WH7760> the royal<WH4438> crown<WH3804> upon her head<WH7218>, and made her queen<WH4427> instead of Vashti<WH2060>.

Then the king<WH4428> made<WH6213> a great<WH1419> feast<WH4960> unto all his princes<WH8269> and his servants<WH5650>, even Esther<WH635>'s feast<WH4960>; and he made<WH6213> a release<WH2010> to the provinces<WH4082>, and gave<WH5414> gifts<WH4864>, according to the state<WH3027> of the king<WH4428>.
And when the virgins<WH1330> were gathered together<WH6908> the second time<WH8145>, then Mordecai<WH4782> sat<WH3427> in the king<WH4428>'s gate<WH8179>.

Esther<WH635> had not yet showed<WH5046> her relatives<WH4138> nor her people<WH5971>; as Mordecai<WH4782> had commanded<WH6680> her<WH635>: for Esther did<WH6213> the commandment<WH3982> of Mordecai<WH4782>, like as when she was brought up with him<WH545>.

In those days<WH3117>, while Mordecai<WH4782> sat<WH3427> in the king<WH4428>'s gate<WH8179>, two<WH8147> of the king<WH4428>'s chamberlains<WH5631>, Bigthan<WH904> and Teresh<WH8657>, of those which kept<WH8104> the door<WH5592>, were angry<WH7107>, and sought<WH1245> to lay<WH7971> hand<WH3027> on the king<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325>.

And the thing<WH1697> was known<WH3045> to Mordecai<WH4782>, who told<WH5046> it unto Esther<WH635> the queen<WH4436>; and Esther<WH635> certified<WH559> the king<WH4428> there in Mordecai<WH4782>'s name<WH8034>.

And when inquisition<WH1245> was made of the matter<WH1697>, it was found out<WH4672>; therefore they were both<WH8147> hanged<WH8518> on a tree<WH6086>: and it was written<WH3789> in the book<WH5612> of the chronicles<WH1697> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>.
